name: ✝IN LOVING MEMORY✝
description:
GMTK 2021 Game Jam Theme: "Joined Together" MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
  • 2x Players
  • 1x Gamepad
NICE TO HAVE FOR EXTRA FUN
  • 4x Players
  • 2x Gamepads
PITCH A dark-themed cooperative Octodad-like physics game. HOW TO WIN
  • Carry the coffin until the end of the hallway and put it on the altar.
  • Try to stay synchronized with the other players.
HOW TO LOSE
  • If a pallbearer is to far from the coffin, he will drop it.
  • If a pallbearer is hit by an obstable, he will also drop the coffin.
  • If the corpse get out of the coffin, you lose.
TIPS
  • Pallbearers have a stamina system. The higher they lift the coffin, the quicker they will walk. But they also get tired more rapidly. If they run out of stamina, they will rest for a few seconds.
CREDITS Game Design, Graphic Design, Sound Design, Programming
  • Karl Fayeton

(PlayStation Gamepad 3D model courtesy of Alexis Bastieri)

Music tracks
  • Astronomia by Tony Igy
  • Marche Funèbre (Sonate pour Piano n°2), Frédéric Chopin
TECHNOLOGY
  • Unity 2021.1
  • Audacity
  • Photoshop
  • Unity Plugins: ProBuilder, DOTween, Rewired
INSPIRATION

The famous meme video of the fabulous Dancing Pallbearers.

POST MORTEM
  • I made this jam solo, so graphics and sound are pretty basic, unfortunately.
  • I didn't know how to make a proper ragdoll, so I used Spring Joints on capsules to tie them together, which can cause bugs (but they're fun to watch so it's ok).
  • The most difficult design challenge was to teach players how to hold the controller together without having to make special art.
  • I didn't have my headset, so audio mixing was made with the crappiest laptop built-in speakers. Sorry about that.
  • I wanted to keep keyboard compatibility, but gameplay just didn't feel right without analog controls.  The game only works on gamepad with analog triggers.
  • On the first draft, players were able to separately lift the coffin and walk forward. I tied the two commands on the same axis to better fit the theme (Joined Together), and to make the game more accessible.
  • After the jam I will upload a new build with alternative joystick Y-Axis controls in addition of triggers.
